CatDescriptText: Sally O'Shea, 1811 Sciota Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 5, 1958, pg. 1 with question: "What do you think is wrong with the Pittsburgh Pirates? Do you think that they are using their best ball players at all times?" answer reads: "I don't think that anything is wrong with the Pirates.  They are doing a good job.  This is shown by the fact that three Pirates are All Star game..."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Sally O'Shea, wearing dark skirt, light colored varsity style zippered jacket with striped collar, cuffs, waistband, and embroidered lettering inscribed "...lly", and polka dot and striped blouse with knot tied at neck, standing in front of light colored wall, left store window displaying female mannequin wearing light colored sleeveless polka dot dress with dark sheer overlay, store window on right displaying men's dress shoes with sign inscribed "...tom Tips..."
